Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First I am considering the normative rules from Part 1 These are strict and must be followed The sequence is Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant If Approved Finalize Documentation Close Case Key ordering rules Credit Check before Risk Assessment Risk Assessment before Loan Decision Inform Applicant after Loan Decision If approved Finalize Documentation before Close Case If rejected no Finalize Documentation Whats not allowed Skipping steps Changing order Finalizing documentation after rejection Closing case without proper logic

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Now desiderata from Part 2 are recommended but not strict Credit Check within 24 hours of Application Received Inform Applicant within 48 hours of Loan Decision Perform a Follow up Call before closing the case not mentioned in the log so I need to check if its done or not

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Event log has three cases Case 1 Case 2 Case 3 I need to 1 Identify normative violations and explain 2 Identify desiderata failures and note theyre not severe 3 Suggest interpretations or justifications where possible Lets analyze each case step by step

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 1 2024 01 10 09 00 Application Received 09 30 Credit Check 10 00 Risk Assessment 11 00 Loan Decision Approved 13 00 Inform Applicant 13 30 Finalize Documentation 14 00 Close Case Sequence Starts with App Received then Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant Finalize Doc since approved Close Case Order is correct No skipping no wrong order Decision is approved so Finalize Doc before Close Case is done Normative No violations Desiderata Credit Check within 24 hours Received at 09 00 Check at 09 30 same day within 24 hours good Inform Applicant within 48 hours of Loan Decision Decision at 11 00 Inform at 13 00 same day within 48 hours good Follow up Call Not mentioned in log so probably not done This is a desideratum failure

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 2024 01 11 08 00 Application Received 08 20 Risk Assessment No prior Credit Check violates normative 09 00 Credit Check after Risk Assessment wrong order 09 30 Loan Decision Rejected 10 00 Finalize Documentation not allowed after rejection 10 30 Close Case Normative violations Risk Assessment before Credit Check Should be Credit Check before Risk Assessment Finalize Documentation after rejection Explicitly not allowed Also the sequence is messed up App Received Risk Assessment skip Credit Check initially then Credit Check after which is out of order Loan Decision after Risk Assessment thats ok but Inform Applicant is missing Wait look at the log Activities App Received Risk Assessment Credit Check Loan Decision Finalize Documentation Close Case No Inform Applicant step According to normative rules Inform Applicant must occur after Loan Decision And in the sequence its part of the flow So violations Credit Check not before Risk Assessment Risk Assessment happened first Inform Applicant skipped entirely Finalize Documentation after rejection Possibly closing case without informing applicant but mainly the steps are wrong Justification Maybe there was a system error or human mistake but no justification can make this compliant

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 3 2024 01 12 09 00 Application Received 2024 01 14 10 00 Credit Check two days later 2024 01 14 11 00 Risk Assessment 2024 01 14 12 00 Loan Decision Approved 2024 01 16 15 00 Inform Applicant two days after decision Lets calculate Decision on Jan 14 12 00 Inform on Jan 16 15 00 Thats about 2 days and 3 hours later 2024 01 17 09 00 Finalize Documentation 2024 01 17 10 00 Close Case Sequence App Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant Finalize Documentation Close Case Order seems correct for approved case No skipping no wrong order apparent Normative Should be fine as long as all steps are in order and decision logic is followed Desiderata Credit Check within 24 hours Received Jan 12 09 00 Credit Check Jan 14 10 00 Thats 2 days later so more than 24 hours violation of desideratum Inform Applicant within 48 hours of Loan Decision Decision Jan 14 12 00 Inform Jan 16 15 00 Time difference from Jan 14 12 00 to Jan 16 12 00 is exactly 48 hours but inform is at 15 00 so 51 hours total So more than 48 hours desideratum violation Follow up Call Not mentioned so probably not done desideratum failure

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Now for normative violations summary Case 1 No normative violations Case 2 Multiple normative violations Risk Assessment before Credit Check order violation No Inform Applicant step skipping required activity Finalize Documentation after rejection Case 3 No normative violations sequence is correct In Case 3 the order is correct Credit Check before Risk Assessment etc Timings are late but thats desideratum

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Now desiderata failures Case 1 Fails to meet the desideratum of performing a Follow up Call Credit Check and Inform Applicant are timely Case 2 Likely fails all desiderata due to normative violations but specifically No Inform Applicant so cannot be within 48 hours Credit Check might be timely but order wrong no Follow up Call But primary issues are normative Case 3 Fails to meet Credit Check within 24 hours took 2 days Inform Applicant within 48 hours took about 51 hours No Follow up Call Clarify that these are not severe Follow up Call is not in the log for any case so all cases might have this desideratum failure In Case 3 log it says No Follow up Call explicitly but for others its not mentioned but probably absent Assuming if not listed it didnt happen

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Justifications For Case 2 deviations Could be due to human error system glitch or intentional bypass in urgent situations but it contravenes the strict rules For Case 3 delays Might be justified by external factors like holidays Jan 12 to 14 might include weekend or resource constraints making it suboptimal but not rule breaking Now structure the answer 1 Normative Violations Case 1 No violations Explanation All steps in correct order decision logic followed Case 2 Violations include Risk Assessment performed before Credit Check violating the order Inform Applicant step missing skipping a required activity Finalize Documentation performed after rejection which is not allowed Case 3 No violations Explanation Sequence correct all steps present and in order 2 Desiderata Failures Case 1 Fails to meet the desideratum of performing a Follow up Call Credit Check and Inform Applicant are timely Case 2 Likely fails all desiderata due to normative violations but specifically No Inform Applicant so cannot be within 48 hours Credit Check might be timely but order wrong no Follow up Call Case 3 Fails to meet Credit Check within 24 hours took 2 days Inform Applicant within 48 hours took about 51 hours No Follow up Call Clarify that these are not severe 3 Justifications For Case 2 deviations Could be due to human error system glitch or intentional bypass in urgent situations but it contravenes the strict rules For Case 3 delays Might be justified by external factors like holidays Jan 12 to 14 might include weekend or resource constraints making it suboptimal but not rule breaking
